intro: Ptilotus gaudichaudii var. parviflorus, commonly known as the small-flowered spinifex, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, pale yellow to green flowers that are clustered in dense heads. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy soils. Its unique appearance and adaptability make it a notable species in its native habitat.
